home_tl.Hero_section-header: Creating Change Makers of Tomorrow with 21st Century Skills
home_tl.Hero_section-description: Nurture a culture of social innovation and build skills while inspiring young people to become transformative leaders.
home_tl.about_us_desc:
MoE, UNICEF & Partners launch Adolescent Skills and Employability Bhutan Project

Thimphu May 20, 2022: To equip adolescents and young people with life skills that would empower them to seize opportunities, confront challenges access meaningful employment, the Adolescent Skills and Employability (ASE) Bhutan Project was in Thimphu.

Her Royal Highness Ashi Chimi Yangzom Wangchuck, the Vice President of Bhutan Youth Development Fund launched the project along with representatives from the UN, the Government agencies, private sector and CSOs.

Led by the Ministry of Education in partnership with Bhutan Youth Development Fund, Loden Foundation and UNICEF, the ASE project will equip at least 10,000 young people with 21 st Century skills by December 2022.

The project will be rolled out through 64 schools and 10 youth centers across the country by focal persons using two programmatic approach– UPSHIFT and UNISOLVE, initiatives of UNICEF’s Office of Innovation.

Director General, Ministry of Education, Karma Galay shared that the quality of education and skills is one of the National Key Result Areas in the 12th Five Year Plan and aligned to SDG 4. He added that this partnership to empower our children with the skills and competencies for the 21st Century would facilitate their access to gainful employment and lifelong learning. “The ASE project complements the on-going efforts of the Ministry to invest in our future,” the Director General said.

At least 25 officials from agencies working with and for young people were trained as a master trainer and focal are trained as a facilitator to rollout the UPSHIFT programme in 64 schools and 10 youth centers.

Executive Director of Youth Development Fund, Dorji Ohm, said, “the ASE project is in the making of the power capsule for the young people of 21st Century.”

Executive Director of Loden Foundation Tshewang Tashi, said, “ASE is an investment in our children and is the legacy of this generation to the next generation.”

UNICEF and its Office of Innovation is supporting four countries in South Asia – Bangladesh, Bhutan,India and the Maldives to scale up skilling program for eight million young people.

UNICEF Bhutan Representative Dr Will Parks said that adolescents, children aged 10–19, are growing up in a transforming, complex world.

“To keep up, adolescents must be able to seize opportunities and confront challenges. They need education and skills to become lifelong learners, to secure productive work, to make informed decisions and to positively engage in their communities,” Dr Will Parks said. “The Adolescent Skills and Employability Bhutan Project or ASE Bhutan is an initiative that builds on the development in an adolescent’s first decade of life, to help them navigate risks and vulnerabilities in their second decade of life, and to set them on the path to fulfilling their potential.”

Also known as transferable skills or life skills, 21st Century skills allow young people to become agile learners and global citizens equipped to navigate personal, social, academic, and economic challenges.These skills also help young people affected by crisis cope with trauma and build resilience. They include problem-solving, negotiation, managing emotions, empathy and communication.

Leveraging the digital platforms and partnership, the ASE Project will inspire today’s young people to become tomorrow’s leaders.
home_tl.about_upshift_desc:
UPSHIFT is a UNICEF global innovation for transferable skills building of adolescents and young people that is now in implementation in 45 countries. UPSHIFT is designed to build transferable skills and create opportunity, with a focus on the young people. UPSHIFT supports the development of skills for life and livelihood and supports youth to positively engage with their local communities as change-makers.
[LEARN MORE ABOUT UPSHIFT ]

With the goal of engaging and skilling more adolescents and young people, UNICEF, along with partners embarked on the development of UNISOLVE.
home_tl.upshift_power_desc:
UNISOLVE is a digital platform designed to facilitate UPSHIFT delivery through a school-based, teacher-facilitated blended learning model.

UNISOLVE combines the advantages of distance learning opportunities and face-to-face activities to promote creativity and innovation among adolescents and young people. Designed with and for the education system keeping scalability in mind this specially designed platform, UNISOLVE, is a tool to skill students on social innovation and 21st century skills.
home_tl.idea_heading_1: Empowering young minds to become social innovators | UNICEF Bhutan
home_tl.idea_desc_1: Multipurpose Agriculture Bag can be used for plucking cotton, Chilli, vegetables, fruits and spreading fertilizers in the agriculture field.
home_tl.idea_heading_2: Empowering adolescents to become changemakers | UNICEF Bhutan
home_tl.idea_desc_2: Using available waste materials on the campus like waste palm wheels, coconut leaves, a stick, and wheels of small cycles, these students made a makeshift sweeping machine to help the aged sweeper.
home_tl.idea_desc_3: When the user pushes the front legs of the walker on the upper stairs and the rear legs rest on the lower stairs, the walker is stable enough for climbing. It also has a foldable seat that can be pulled out.
home_tl.testimonials_desc_1: Compared to schools in urban areas, students in remote areas have low competency skills and comparatively low self-esteem, However, with UPSHIFT, I believe that students will learn to think out of the box and make good use of the resources available around them.
home_tl.testimonials_title_1: one of the teacher participants believes UPSHIFT would help shift her students’ learning
home_tl.testimonials_desc_2: When teachers from remote schools are also involved, our students can benefit in many ways. </br></br>Students can now identify their problems and come up with solutions.
home_tl.testimonials_title_2: a teacher at Kothaka Primary School in the western district of Wangdue
home_tl.testimonials_desc_3: People often talk about innovations, but never about the skills involved to innovate. It is a collection of information, perspective, and data from different stakeholders involved. Our schools have different programmes but they either focus on the process or the product.
home_tl.testimonials_title_3: a teacher at Gedu Higher Secondary School in the southern district of Chukha
home_tl.faq_qn_1: What is the School Innovation Challenge?
home_tl.faq_ans_1: To promote the culture of innovation and creative problem solving, Ministry of Education in partnership with UNICEF and partners proposes to conduct a school-level innovation challenge for schools across Bhutan. The of the school innovation challenge is to introduce the children to the Design Thinking and Innovation as a approach to problem-solving.
home_tl.faq_qn_2: Which students can take part in this Challenge?
home_tl.faq_ans_2:
• SIC is for students of primary, lower, middle, and higher secondary schools including colleges and out of school youth

  • Students in a team can be from different grades.

  • Interested students irrespective of academic performance can take part in the School Innovation Challenge.
home_tl.faq_qn_3: How many teams and teachers/mentors can participate in the program?
home_tl.faq_ans_3: The platform does not have any limitation in terms of the number of teams or students. But it is suggested that teacher/mentor:teams ratio be maintained as 1:5.
home_tl.faq_qn_4: How to register your institution for this program?
home_tl.faq_ans_4: Open the website and click register. Register your school/Institution there by entering the UDISE code/Unique ID and then filling in all required details. Once the registration process is completed, you can log in to your account by entering a password.
home_tl.faq_qn_5: What are the next steps involved after registering my school on the website?
home_tl.faq_ans_5:
The following are the next steps involved after you register your school/institution:

  1. Identify students who can participate in the program.

  2. Form teams with the interested or nominated participant group.

  3. Students have to log in to the website and start doing the online course with the team.

  4. Teams will complete the learning course and submit one idea as their challenge project.
home_tl.roadmpa_one_desc:
Learners become aware of Program, its goals and process through various channels like :

  1. Institution management

  2. Digital and print media

  3. Peer Groups
home_tl.roadmpa_two_desc: Learners consult their teachers, form a team, and register themselves to the platform.
home_tl.roadmpa_three_desc: Learners undergo the interactive and gamified course under Program
home_tl.roadmpa_four_desc: Learners test the solution and prototype in the real world with a subset of target group users for iteration
home_tl.roadmpa_five_desc:
Learners submit their idea to the selection panel for shortlisting

The shortlisted ideas are provided an opportunity to pitch their ideas at the state and national level for incubation
home_tl.roadmpa_six_desc: Solutions selected in the final event are provided support to actualize their solutions and implement their ideas

get_started.heading: Welcome Students!
get_started.desc:
We are glad that you have signed-up to this program and joined us in this exciting journey of nurturing an experience of learning, skilling and innovation for the young people. As you are aware you will be playing a role of student for the participants in their learning journey.

This portal gives you an experience of learning modules and important resources for supporting the participants. You can also register and track progress of your teams using the dashboard.

Your journey as a teacher/mentor will involve the following key milestones:

  • Step-1: Take Pre-Survey
  • Step-2: Complete the course and reading material
  • Step-3: Register the teams
  • Step-4: Support the participants in completing the learning journey.
  • Step-5: Support the participants in challenge/idea submission.
  • Step-6: Complete the post survey.

We hope you and your teams will have a great learning experience and wish you all the best for this program!

teacher_get_started.heading: Welcome Teachers and Mentors!
teacher_get_started.desc:
We are glad that you have signed-up to this program and joined us in this exciting journey of nurturing an experience of learning, skilling and innovation for the young people. As you are aware you will be playing a role of guide and mentor for the participants in their learning journey.

This portal gives you an experience of learning modules and important resources for supporting the participants. You can also register and track progress of your teams using the dashboard.

Your journey as a teacher/mentor will involve the following key milestones:

  • Step-1: Take Pre-Survey.

  • Step-2: Complete the course and reading material.

  • Step-3: Register the teams

  • Step-4: Support the participants in completing the learning journey.

  • Step-5: Support the participants in challenge/idea submission.

  • Step-6: Complete the post survey.

We hope you and your teams will have a great learning experience and wish you all the best for this program!

student_get_started.heading: Welcome Students!
student_get_started.desc:
We are glad that you are part of this program and have joined us in this exciting journey of learning, skilling and innovation. There are many exciting things awaiting you in this journey.

You will learn through this platform, work with your team and be supported by your teachers as well.

Your journey as a participant will involve the following key steps:

  • Step 1: Take Pre-Survey

  • Step 2: Start the course by watching the video.

  • Step 3: Complete each module and attempt the Quiz.

  • Step 4: Work with your team on the worksheets in each module to complete your own problem solving journey.

  • Step 5: Submit your team’s final idea.

  • Step 6: Complete the post survey.

We hope you and your teams will have a great learning experience and wish you all the best for this program!

student.worksheet:
Dear Student,

Step-1: Download and print this worksheet or get a copy from your SIDP guide teacher.

Step-2: Complete this worksheet along with your team members.

Step-3: Handover the worksheet to your guide teacher once your team completes the worksheet without fail. This needs to be submitted to District Coordinator during regional level boot-camp.

Step-4: Continue to next lesson only after you complete the worksheet.

Hope you and your team learn new things and enjoy completing this worksheet.
student.take_challenge: Test your course skills in a short test challenge!

dummytext.student_idea_sub: அன்புள்ள மாணவரே, நீங்களும் உங்கள் குழு உறுப்பினர்களும் SIDP கற்றல் பயணத்தை முடித்தவுடன் IDEA SUBMISSION செய்யலாம். இதற்கு உங்கள் வழிகாட்டி ஆசிரியர் உங்களுக்கு உதவுவார்.
dummytext.student_my_cer:
அன்புள்ள மாணவரே, நீங்கள் படிப்பை முடித்து யோசனையைச் சமர்ப்பித்தவுடன் உங்கள் சான்றிதழ் கிடைக்கும்.

இவற்றை நீங்கள் முடித்திருந்தால், உங்கள் சான்றிதழ் விரைவில் தயாராகிவிடும்.

உங்கள் தேர்வுகளுக்கு அனைத்து நல்வாழ்த்துக்கள்!
dummytext.student_post_survey: அன்புள்ள மாணவர்களே, நீங்கள் படிப்பை முடித்ததும் உங்கள் குழு சிந்தனையை சமர்ப்பித்ததும் பிந்தைய கணக்கெடுப்பு (post - survey) செயலில் இருக்கும். நீங்களும் உங்கள் அணியும் நிறைய புதிய விஷயங்களைக் கற்றுக்கொண்டு இருக்கிறீர்கள் என்று நம்புகிறேன். :
dummytext.student_course: அன்புள்ள மாணவரே, உங்கள் SIDP கற்றல் பயணம் விரைவில் தொடங்கும். உங்கள் பள்ளி SIDP தலைமை மற்றும் வழிகாட்டி ஆசிரியருடன் கலந்துரையாடி பயணத்திற்கு உங்களை தயார்படுத்துங்கள். வாழ்த்துகள் : )
dummytext.certificate_msg: உங்கள் சான்றிதழ் மேலே உள்ள விவரங்களுடன் அச்சிடப்படும். மேலே உள்ளவற்றில் ஏதேனும் மாற்றங்கள் இருந்தால், கீழே உள்ள படிகளைப் பின்பற்றவும்:</br>1.ஏதேனும் எழுத்துப் பிழை இருந்தால், உங்கள் வழிகாட்டி ஆசிரியரிடம் ஆசிரியர் உள்நுழைவுப் பக்கத்தில் உள்ள எழுத்துப்பிழைகளைத் திருத்துமாறு கோருங்கள்</br>2. பெயருக்கு முன்னால் initial, உங்களது முழுப் பெயர் விடுபட்டிருந்தால் அல்லது தவறாக இருந்தால், ஆசிரியர் உள்நுழைவின் அணிகள்  பக்கத்தில் பெயரைப் புதுப்பிக்குமாறு உங்கள் வழிகாட்டி ஆசிரியரைக் கோருங்கள்</br>(பெயரில் ‘.’ எதுவும் இருக்கக்கூடாது. உதாரணம்: உங்கள் முழுப் பெயர் கே. விஜய் குமார் எனில், ஏதேனும் .(புள்ளி) அல்லது சிறப்பு எழுத்துகளுடன் கே.விஜய் குமார் என்று சேர்க்கப்பட வேண்டும்)</br></br>குறிப்பு:
dummytext.name: பெயர் :

badges.earn: you've just earned a new badge

student_course.continue_to_idea: கண்டுபிடிப்பு (ஐடியா )  சமர்ப்பிப்புக்குச் செல்ல தொடரவும் என்பதைக் கிளிக் செய்யவும்.
student_course.sdg: நீங்கள் எந்த நிலையான வளர்ச்சிக்கான  இலக்குகளை  (SDG) உங்கள் தீர்வுக்கான  இலக்காகக் கொண்டீர்களா? உங்கள் சிந்தனை (கண்டுபிடிப்பு) எந்த நிலையான வளர்ச்சி இலக்கிற்கும் உகந்ததாக  இல்லை என்றால், மற்றவற்றைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும்.
student_course.sdg_desc: (நீங்கள் FIND தொகுதியிலிருந்து SDGs படிவத்தினைப்  பார்த்து சரியான விருப்பத்தைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கலாம்)
student_course.others: மேலே உள்ள கேள்வியில்  'மற்றவை' என்ற விருப்பத்தை நீங்கள் தேர்ந்தெடுத்திருந்தால்,  உங்கள் தீர்வு எந்த நி.வ.இ அல்லது வகை (theme) பற்றியது  என்பதை எழுதவும்.
